discussion.content: D-Responding to Change over Following a Plan 2.2

questions.question_text: The Agile principle `welcome changing requirements, even late in development` relates to which agile manifesto?

choices.B: Individuals and interactions over processes and tools
choices.D: Responding to change over following a plan

questions.question_text:
Given the following information:
✑ Activity A takes one week.
✑ Activity B takes three weeks.
✑ Activity C takes two weeks.
✑ Activity D takes five weeks.
✑ Activity A starts at the same time as Activity B.
✑ Activity C follows Activity B and Activity A.
✑ Activity D follows Activity C.
How long will it take to complete the project?

discussion.content:
WAIT god damn AI
thats not right, it starts at week 6 and takes 5 weeks, thats 10 weeks not 11 

Sorry!!

11 weeks:

Activity A starts and takes one week.
Activity B starts at the same time as Activity A and takes three weeks. So, at the end of Week 3, both A and B are complete.
Activity C follows A and B. Since A and B are complete at the end of Week 3, C starts in Week 4 and takes two weeks. So, at the end of Week 5, Activity C is complete.
Activity D follows C. Since C is complete at the end of Week 5, D starts in Week 6 and takes five weeks. So, at the end of Week 11, Activity D is complete.
Therefore, the total time to complete the project is 11 weeks.

Selected Answer: C
C. 
Planning out the critical path is B>C>D for a total time of 10 weeks

Selected Answer: C
C for sure
5th week : A, B, C done

C

The sum of the activity durations in the Critical Path is equal to the Project’s Duration; therefore, a delay to any Critical Activity will result in a delay to the Project Completion Date.

questions.question_text: Which of the following best correspond to the organizational process assets (OPAs) that affect the project?

choices.A: Policies and lessons learned from other projects
choices.B: Information technology software and employee capability

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Validation and control relates to monitoring and controlling project work to ensure that deliverables meet stakeholders' expectations and are in line with the project management plan. Tailoring in this aspect involves determining the appropriate validation and control measures based on the project's unique requirements.

Selected Answer: B

questions.question_text: What is a tailoring consideration in Project Integration Management?
What important leadership quality/qualities should project manager possess?

discussion.content: B. Refer to PMI Talent Triangle pg. 57

choices.D: Industry and organizational expertise that enhances performance
choices.A: Skills and behaviors related to specific domains of project management
choices.B: Skills and behaviors needed to guide a team and help an organization reach its goals
choices.C: Industry expertise that helps to better deliver business outcomes
